level.heading: Membership and organization of the Library Enhancement Task Force.

level.text: The Task Force shall be comprised of the following 11 members:
The Mayor, or his or her designee;
The Chairperson of the Committee on Education, Libraries, and Recreation of the Council of the District of Columbia, or his or her designee;
The Chairperson of the Committee on Economic Development of the Council of the District of Columbia, or his or her designee;
The Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development, or his or her designee;
The Deputy Mayor for Children, Youth, Families and Elders, or his or her designee;
The Chief Financial Officer, or his or her designee;

The President of the Board of Library Trustees; the Chairperson of the Board of Library Trustees' Facilities Committee; and a third member of the Board of Library Trustees designated by the Board President; and
Two public members, one of whom shall be appointed by the Mayor and one of whom shall be appointed by the Council by resolution, to serve 3-year terms.
Vacancies occurring in the Task Force shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointees.
The President of the Board of Library Trustees shall serve as Chairperson.
The following 3 persons, or their designees, shall serve as ex-officio, nonvoting members of the Task Force:
The Director of the District of Columbia Public Library;
The Superintendent of the District of Columbia Public Schools; and
The President of the University of the District of Columbia.
Each member shall serve without compensation, except that members may receive reimbursement for expenses incurred in the service of the Task Force.
The DCPL shall provide staffing for the Task Force.
